intro: Iozoste sesquipedalis, commonly known as the giant sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its tall, spindly stems that can reach heights of up to three meters. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pale blue or violet in color. Its leaves are narrow and succulent, adapted to store water in its native habitat. Iozoste sesquipedalis is often found growing in sandy or rocky soils, thriving in environments with low rainfall.
